results.title: The Wicker man
results.creator_credit: British Lion Film Productions, Peter Snell and Robin Hardy
results.brief_description: A spell binding occult thriller by writer Anthony Shaffer. A policeman goes to a remote Scottish Island to investigate the disappearance of a local girl and discovers a society of modern pagans worshipping the ancient gods of Earth, Rain and Sun. They are led by a sinister overlord in erotic rituals and savage ceremonies of human sacrifice and weave a web of hedonistic pleasure and terror around the puritanical, holier-than-thou policeman. When he finally discovers what happened to the girl, his nightmare is only just beginning!

results.title: The White balloon
results.creator_credit: CMI, Dendy Films, Ferdos Films and Jafar Panahi
results.brief_description: This wonderful motion picture is the story of a young Iranian girl’s search for the perfect goldfish to release in her pond to encourage good luck in the New Year. However, when she loses the money her mother has given her, young Razieh and her brother seek their fortunes in modern day Tehran. This visually ravishing contemporary retelling of “The Red Balloon”, reveals much about the culture of the Muslim world. By filming through a child’s eyes, director Jafar Panahi reveals a world of incidental cruelty, a world which often rushes by too fast to listen to the desires of children. There is a darkness in “The White Balloon”, not explicit, but a sadness about the opportunities adults lose in understanding the world of their child. As in all the best fairy-tales, this is a profoundly humane story. The screenplay is by acclaimed director Abbas Kiarostami. Winner of the Camera D’Or at the 1995 Cannes Film Festival.

results.title: The Whipping boy
results.creator_credit: Gemini Films, Ellen Freyer and Syd Macartney
results.brief_description: Based on the Newberry Award winning novella by Sid Fleichman, ‘The Whipping boy’ tells the story of spoiled Prince Horace and Jemmy a streetwise orpan who is `conscripted’ into becoming the Prince’s whipping boy; a stand-in for the the Prince when he is to be punished. When the Prince’s pranks, designed to get his father’s attention, bring the country to the brink of war, he and Jemmy escape into the wide world and a series of adventures destined to change their lives.

results.title: The Wedding singer
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Robert Simonds, Brad Grey and Frank Coraci
results.brief_description: Set in 1985, this romantic comedy is pure 80’s nostalgia. Robbie Hart (Adam Sandler) is a singer at weddings and bar mitzvahs who sings hits of the eighties and knows how to keep the crowd happy. Julia (Drew Barrymore), is a waitress at the reception centre where Robbie often performs. When Robbie is stood up at the altar, he finds consolation in his new friendship with Julia, and he starts to fall for her. The only problem is that Julia is engaged to womaniser, Glenn, and asks Robbie to help her with her wedding plans. Robbie has to figure out how to make Julia realise that she is marrying the wrong man. Includes a great cameo by Steve Buscemi.

results.title: The Wedding banquet
results.creator_credit: Central Motion Pictures Corporation, Good Machine, Ted Hope, James Schamus and Ang Lee
results.brief_description: Wai Tung, a successful real estate investor lives in New York with his lover Simon. Wai Tung’s parents, wondering why he is unmarried, enrol him with a matchmaking service. Simon believes the solution is for Wai Tung to marry Wei Wei, an illegal immigrant desperate to remain in America; a marriage of convenience solving both their problems! When the news reaches Taiwan, Wai Tung’s parents board the first plane to the Big Apple so they can preside over the traditional wedding banquet. Suddenly a little white lie turns into a fully fledged farce as the simple registry office ceremony escalates into an over-the-top reception where everyone wants to kiss the bride - except the groom! Starring Ah-Leh Gua, Sihung Lung, May Chin, Winston Chao and Mitchell Litchenstein. Winner Golden Bear Best Film: Berlin Film Festival, Best Director and Best Film: Seattle Film Festival, Critics Choice Best Film: Sydney Film Festival. Chinese dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: The Way we were
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Rastar Productions, Ray Stark and Sydney Pollack
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand and Robert Redford star in one of Hollywood’s legendary love stories. Redford is the boy who sets out to become the top film writer in Hollywood and Streisand is the outspoken activist. Their love binds them together, but their beliefs put them on a collision course which ultimately tears them apart. Redford is charming as the all-American WASP boy, while Streisands performance as the “blue-stocking” Jewish activist is moving, as she vacillates between fragility and passionate committment to her causes. Although uneven and at times unashamedly sentimental, the film is a classic of its genre. Marvin Hamlisch’s score and the title song earned Oscars for the film.

results.title: The Way of the dragon = Return of the dragon
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Raymond Chow and Bruce Lee
results.brief_description: Tang Lung travels to Rome to help save a family friend’s restaurant which is being threatened by a powerful gang boss. Initially seen as an embarrassment amongst his Chinese friends, Tang Lung is soon held in high esteem when he reveals his masterful martial arts skills defending the restaurant against the thugs. The gang boss begins a number of attacks on the restaurant in an effort to defeat Tang Lung. He finally flies in an American martial arts assassin to challenge Tang Lung to fight to the death. Cast includes: Bruce Lee, Nora Miao and Chuck Norris. Dubbed into English.

results.title: The Watermelon Woman
results.creator_credit: Dancing Girl Productions, Barry Swimar, Alexandra Juhasz and Cheryl Dunye
results.brief_description: One of the first feature films made by an African American lesbian, this ‘mockumentary’ ostensibly investigates the life of a forgotten black actress from the thirties known only as, the Watermelon Woman. Filmmaker Cheryl Dunye plays herself as a video shop employee and budding film director who begins researching the actress with a view to making a movie based upon her life story. As she uncovers archival footage and conducts interviews with archivists, scholars (played in a series of cameos by real-life experts including Camille Paglia) and women who lived in the Philadelphia area in the thirties, Dunye pieces together a previously unacknowledged history of African American lesbian life in the thirties. She finds that the Watermelon Woman was a nightclub singer named Fae Richards who was the lover of the white Hollywood female director, Martha Page. Meanwhile, Dunye herself falls in love with Diana (Guinevere Turner), one of the customers that frequent the video store where she works. Their passionate relationship allows her to explore her own feelings around interracial romance. The film functions on two levels, as a wry, irreverent look at contemporary black lesbian culture, and as a critique of official narratives that have erased this culture from history. While Dunye ultimately reveals the Watermelon Woman as a fiction, she points out that “sometimes you have to create you own history”.

results.title: The Waterboy
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Robert Simonds, Jack Giarraputo and Frank Coraci
results.brief_description: In this comedic film of sight gags Adam Sandler plays the role of Bobby Boucher, a water boy for the local college football team. Bobby cops it from all directions - his over-bearing mother (Kathy Bates), the football team and even the coach (Jerry Reed). When the coach fires him, Bobby is forced to join the rival team under Coach Klein (Henry Winkler) where he turns his talents from water boy to a star tackler setting this losing team on the road to victory. Love, glory and revenge await Bobby as he takes up his new life as a football hero and college student. Cast includes Fairuza Balk, Blake Clark and Larry Gilliard Jr.

results.title: The Wasp woman [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Film Group Feature, Santa Cruz Productions and Roger Corman
results.brief_description: A beautiful woman by day - a lusting queen wasp by night. Janice Starlin (Susan Cabot), cosmetics entrepreneur and former model approaching middle age, teams up with an unemployed research scientist who has just developed a youth serum derived from wasps. Starlin volunteers to be a human guinea pig, to the horror of her employees and corporate advisers. The serum cuts eighteen years off her age and makes her radiant, but Starlin learns that there are a few flies in the ointment. The epitome of B-films, Corman quickly pushes aside trivial matters such as logic and science to create a great yarn, although his treatment of the story written by Leo Gordon and Kinta Zertuche, confuses the audience as to whether this film concerns bees or wasps. Music by Fred Katz.
